com.xceptance.xlt.nocoding.util.context

Class Context

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xceptance.xlt.nocoding.util.context.Context
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DomContext, LightWeightContext

    public abstract class Context
extends java.lang.Object
    The context for the execution. Thus, the context has methods for handling the DataStorage, XltWebClient, resolving variables, creating the current WebResponse and accessing properties.
    Author:
    ckeiner

        Creates a new Context, sets default Values in the DataStorage and configures the XltWebClient according to the XltProperties
        Parameters:
        xltProperties - The properties to use - normally XltProperties.getInstance()
        dataStorage - The DataStorage you want to use

      • resolveString

        public java.lang.String resolveString(java.lang.String toResolve)
        Resolves every variable of a specified string. If a variable is specified and no value for it can be found, the variable doesn't get resolved
        Parameters:
        toResolve - The string which might have variables
        Returns:
        A string with the resolved variables
